page.title: 03SOUTHBOURNE IN WORLD WAR TWO
page.content: During the Second World War,there was very little bombing in Southbourne but two planes crashed,one on the Hermitage and one on the mud at Prinsted.A lot of planes went over because Thorney Island was an R.A.F.airfield.Some people had their own air raid shelter,but if you didn't,you hid under the stairs or in another safe place. Children from two schools were evacuated to Southbourne,despite its nearness to Portsmouth.They came from a High School in Wimbledon and a Council School in Tooting. The sirens went when there was going to be an air raid.When the war was over,children were given mugs with Union Jack flags on them.There was a big street party to celebrate V.E.Day.
